doc.after: The northern and southern borders of the Thirteen Colonies on the East Coast were largely determined by colonial charters and anchoring coastal settlements The western boundaries were determined by the limits of transportation the infeasibility of settling areas dominated by Native Americans and foreign powers and the decision to create new states out of western territories
